intro: Craterispermum grumileoides, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its delicate, trumpet-shaped flowers that open in the early morning and close by midday. The plant has a fibrous root system adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss. The species belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar climbing or trailing growth habits.
